Reviews.Title: “Very Good Room in a historic building from the 1800's, with very few of the drawbacks of an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivanhny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Mount Vernon district, which is the happening area of the city with a number of great bars, clubs, and restaurants in close walking distance. The hotel is located in a building that is probably from the 1880's, so expect the room layout to be a bit unusual, and the floors and stairways to be a bit creaky. The ceilings must have been at least 12 feet high. We appreciated the thick carpeting, ipod dock, and comfortable bed. The neighborhood seems recently gentrified, and is great for pub crawling, cafes, and hole in the wall restaurants serving excellent food. The real clincher is the price, only $80.00 for a clean and comfortable room in the center of all the action. This hotel is an excellent choice for European travelers or American urbanites who love exploring new neighborhoods. Ma and Pa Kettle on a road trip from Texas with the brood in tow might not particularly like this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hole In The Wall”
Reviews.Author: LATARSHAK
Reviews.Content: Not at all happy with the hotel and the customer service. 1) it said No Smoking but the atmosphere smelled of smoke upon entering the premises. 2) inside stairway needs repair. The carpet is covering up the needed stairs repair. 3) satellite tv only had 4 working stations 4) no clean towels. 5) vending machine only had sodas no bottled water 6) continental breakfast was cereal, milk, juice & bread. I believe the website stated waffles. I could be wrong The hotel is located in a very good area known as Mount Vernon. It's minutes away from the Inner Harbor. The hotel is located on a bus route. There are good restaurants in walking distance. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you need a cheap & quick place to stay

Reviews.Title: “C Hudson”
Reviews.Author: Corinne H
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend visited the Rodeway Inn this Christmas as part of a trip in which we stayed at a total of four accommodations. Of all of these places, the Rodeway Inn had the friendliest staff by far and couldn't do enough to make sure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. As students the affordability was definitely important to us and for what we paid the overall service we got was incredible; clean, spacious and comfortable rooms and an OK breakfast (cereals and toast and coffee and juice), I would recommend the Rodeway Inn to anyone. Also, the Inn is on the route of Baltimore's free bus service into the city center and is less than a 10 minute walk away from the train station- great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Kweku”
Reviews.Author: Kweku M
Reviews.Content: I went to baltimore for some few days on a business trip and I was looking for a hotel that is affordable and the quality is superb.I got Rodeway Inn because of the location and i wasn't disappointed ,it is a very nice hotel with friendly staff.I will always return back there anytime am in town.The staff named Tunde was extremely nice and went extra mile in ensuring that I was comfortable and that I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: William E
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay 12/15/11 Room 121 4th Floor 1. Was offered a room with a dangerous space heater, small and smell of urine, they later moved me to the 4th floor with a promise of central air/heat that worked . 2. Public restroom was absolutly filthly, reaked with urine on entire first floor 3. shower had a curtain with mildew and black growth on the bottom 4. Room telephone didn't work (couldn't call front desk) 5. Low water preasure, in the tiny shower 6. Windows were screwed shut, thus failing to provide a second exit in case of an emergency 7. After a promise by staff that there was heat on room 121, there was NO HEAT in the room and staff made no apologies or offered any further assistance. (the evening staff member) 8. Loose handrails leading up winding stairs 9. Broken last step beneath carpet leading to the second floor 10. Bedding had stains, appeared to either be old food or stains from bugs 11. Extension electric cords used in room, a fire hazard 12. Evening desk clerk refused to issue a receipt for cash paid for the room or offer any documentation or a copy of the document I signed upon paying for the room. 13. Customer service was very poor. Evening clerk displayed little concern to my complaints, offered no resolution, no refund or assistance with accomendations. He simply looked at me with no reply or response. I will also forward a copy of this complaint to the Baltimore Fire Department and the online engine used to locate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: acat_young
Reviews.Content: Very good quality/price, nice location, kind personel! I will return if I go Baltimore next time~~

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember!”
Reviews.Author: ajii
Reviews.Content: Good service......could be better though..the cleanliness and responsiveness of staff to issues bothering customers should be improved with a view to retaining and sustaining the existing customer base and loyalty as well as attract new customers.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!!!1 i dont understand the other reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladream
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed at........ The rooms dirty, The Hotel is falling to pieces and the breakfast is what can i say auful when all you feel is dirty. I was moved rooms twice because the rooms were that bad. the have 1 maid for around 50 rooms so you can imagine how much they get cleaned. Once i arrived back from vacation i complained to the rodeway inn brand not the hotel and received a full refund due to my stay!!! Its official this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at..... Please stay elsewhere. HONEST The only good thing about this hotel is location but honestly stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff and effort, but needs an overhaul!”
Reviews.Author: derek890
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just a night at this hotel in October. I had a late check-in and staff was super friendly and accomodating! Sleep quality was great, even for a street-facing room. I enjoy the old-time, boutiqe-y feeling of this hotel and really appreciated the effort of staff, however I think the hotel does need to be overhauled a bit. While the washrooms were "clean", there was no water pressure for the shower and I found a hair on one of my "clean" towels. The rooms themselves were fine, but you could tell they were quite old and not much attention has been given to their upkeep over the years. Free breakfast downstairs was an added perk, although I didn't take advantage because I was sleeping so soundly. Unfortunately, free wifi is only strong enough on the ground floor. But for the circumstances (late night after a long day of travel and only staying for the one night), the hotel did its job. However, I'm not entirely sure I'd stay here again as I think you could find something comparable for a cheaper price nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Natural Products Expo East tradeshow”
Reviews.Author: Johnny F
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway Inn Mid Town offered my wife and I a very pleasant stay during my businesss trip to Baltimore. We really enoyed the historical significance as well as the friendly way-cool staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rodeway Inn”
Reviews.Author: Maria J
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Everything was satisfactory. Room was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price is cheap”
Reviews.Author: DJErnDawg
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel was probably only good thing about this hotel. I had a terrible room, the tv had 3 working channels. The WiFi was terribly slow, and the air conditioning did not work. The service wasn't bad, just the hotel wasn't in the best condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: caruso2612
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway inn is located in a nice area and close of culture center of the Baltimore. The room is comfortable and the price is good. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Budget" hotel, great location, very helpful staff, I'd stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: bird032
Reviews.Content: If you want modern decor/state of the art amenities, never mind. But the central location, a few blocks from the train station, historic district, good neighborhood, good access to public transportation (free bus stopping just across the street!), at a very reasonable price, makes the Rodeway Inn Mid Town a comfortable and convenient place to stay. The rooms are clean, and the staff very friendly and helpful. Just keep your sense of humor, think Fawlty Towers, and be especially kind to Tony, the maintenance man, and Jamal, the night desk clerk. They are super! Some suggestions: Parking: travellers with autos have a problem. No "hotel" parking, either get lucky parking on the street, or pay expensive rates at nearby lots. They should make a deal with one of the nearby lots! Local knowledge: Where is the nearest ATM machine? The all night shops (7-11)? It would be very handy for travelers staying more than one or two nights to print a map, and hand out copies to guests of useful information about the area. Not the historical stuff, there's already maps for that! For example, within a 10 block radius, the ATM machines, banks, restaurants, convenience stores, grocery stores, drugstores, etc. Warning to international travelers: unless you have an account at one of the local banks, there is no place in Baltimore to exchange foreign currency! No, not the train station! Closest place to do this is B.W.I. Airport. Yes, you can take the light rail train, but prepare to spend a few hours on this mission.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Baltimore for the Inner Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: jennylaced
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good place to stay for the location near the Inner Harbor of Baltimore at a reasonable price! My husband and I stayed in a suite that had free wireless internet, refrigerator, coffee maker, and hair dryer. The continental breakfast was delicious and filling. The hotel staff were pleasant, very helpful, and polite. Across the street from the hotel is the Charm City Circulator - free public transportation throughout the city. This is very convenient. Overall, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good service... but the hotel itself is not the nicest”
Reviews.Author: kippie234
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience with the staff... friendly, courteous, and when a mix-up arose with our billing, the manager Mr. Jatin was very helpful with getting the situation straightened out.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: SarahKate622
Reviews.Content: We chose Roadway Inn because of the price and the great location. (62 dollars a night, about a mile to the inner harbour and a few blocks from mt vernon, a great neighborhood) We had read some of the bad reviews but we are very easy going people and just needed a place to sleep so it seemed perfect. We found a spot right in front of the hotel to park, that wasn't an issue. When we checked in, however, the two men behind the counter told us that while we could stay at the hotel on the first night, we would have to leave and go to another hotel on the 2nd night. These guys own another Roadway Inn 5 miles outside of the city and thats the one they were going to put us up at. They kept telling us that the rooms at the other hotel are much bigger, they all have king size beds and they wern't going to charge us more for staying in a bigger hotel...like they were doing us a favor. When I suggested that our second night should be comped or discounted the general manager got very combative and told me he could just go ahead and cancel my entire reservation if I don't think I have to pay. And then kept insisting that this was a really great deal they were giving us because the rooms were bigger. As I kept trying to tell him that we don't care about the size of the rooms, we want the location. He also said that if we needed a shuttle there would be one, but after a little more probing it turned out he meant he would be driving us in his Subaru. Without any other options we said fine, we would switch hotels in the morning and went about our trip. In the morning I went downstairs to speak to the people at the front desk about what we should do. How do we go about switching hotels? How do we get there? What is everyone else in the hotel doing? The two men (different from the day before) were dumb struck. They had no clue what I was talking about, said people were checking into the hotel for the night and made several remarks to each other that these kinds of shinanigans happen at this hotel often. They suggested I call the Comfort Inn Customer Service line. As they began filing my complaint the woman got real excited and said "oh!! I need you to sign up for the comfort inn rewards program! It's free!! This hotel has so many formal complaints against it that I can actually give you 12,000 rewards points which will get you a free night at a different hotel in our chain" Thats not even taking into acount the shotty rooms. Our ac unit fell out of the window, the shower head wasn't attatched to the wall, there was no internet accessability and our power went out constantly. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, was happy with my stay, value for the money”
Reviews.Author: JuergenHain
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, was happy with my stay, room clean, no smell in my room, window difficult to open, with opened window some street noise as must be expected in the centre of Baltimore. Good location - safe environs, stop of the free inner city bus across the street ("Charm City Circulator"). Old bulilding with a bit of flair of a historic building - no elevator. Compact room. Free breakfast with good coffee, self to make waffles, ... Unfortunately wake-up call came late. Summary: of course not first class, but good accomodation in the center of town and for not so much money.

Reviews.Title: “can’t believe what a bargain this place is...!”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk-6l6
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway Inn is in a very good location, situated in a quiet street, in the heart of Baltimore and only a few steps away from many good and reasonably priced restaurants, etc. Parking is free across the street and there is also an amazing FREE bus service, which stops across from the hotel every ten minutes. The bustling marina area is within walking distance, or a couple of stops away on the FREE bus. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly and we can’t believe what a bargain this place is….we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Your experience may vary - A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: C-VilleDog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly well located, very reasonable in price, and has a quaint European feel to it. I suspect, given the nature of the building, that experiences may vary depending on which room one gets. My room - 116 - was a fourth-floor walkup (no elevator that I could find) accessed by taking the main staircase to the second floor, then a back staircase to the top. The room was European in size (i.e. the bed filled most of the room), which I didn't mind. The window didn't open and the room lacked its own AC. I went to bed warm and stuffy and woke about 2:30 a.m. freezing once the building AC had caught up. In the morning, the shower temp never got past cool. Breakfast was what one might expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Shamba28
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for visitors to Baltimore. There is a free bus service called the circulator which stops right across from the hotel. This bus service runs free tours of the city, also down to the harbour. There are several restaurants a few steps away from the hotel with great vegetarian options (very important to me) I would definitely stay here again and this hotel is fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like family, stay here”
Reviews.Author: jad23
Reviews.Content: When I arrived back at this hotel after the Orioles games it was like home away from home. Mike the manager and his staff are the friendliest and most helpful hotel people you will find anywhere. They create a superb impression of Baltimore which is a terrific city anyway, one I will return to. I have already recommended this hotel to friends. The free bus to downtown is just across the street and several convenience stores are nearby. You can't beat the price for the location either. Sure, the rooms are small but they are well kept and clean. This hotel was once a house.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful, nice, and quaint.”
Reviews.Author: dulcetaina
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel because I had already stayed at a Rodeway Inn in PA and the experience was OK. The Rodeway Inn's staff at Baltimore were much nicer and friendlier than what I have experienced. The room was a nice size and were modestly clean. The bathroom, however, had hair on the floor and in the shower, but I brought it up and it was immediately cleaned. The staff was helpful and although we were late for breakfast (7-10) they still served us coffee and made sure my son had his cereal and juice. I would recommend this hotel to a friend or would stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice to enjoy Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: ahefgjt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 15 minutes walk far from the Baltimore harbor, in a nice location, near to Mt. Vernon. My room was large, very nice and comfortable with TV, queen size bed, a desk. The only issue was an alarm ringing every few minutes also in the night, but it was tolerable. Breakfast was very poor. The staff was kind, available in any request, efficient. A good choice to enjoy Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: abc_LU
Reviews.Content: The people in front dest is kind and warm hearted to help. When they found we have food in the room, they brought a refrigerator there when we leave, The big guys who clean the room offer us candies. Thanks, wish you could see this. Also the breakfest is rich, we really enjoy it in every morning. It is a good place to stay, near the light rail, near inner horbor.

Reviews.Title: “Old and falling apart”
Reviews.Author: PamandBarry0826
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible night's stay. The room did not feel clean, the electricity and the plumbing both seemed out of code and, to top it off, the windows rattled all night long. We got little to no rest. The other issue is the parking. We were told that we could park on the street until 9 am without a problem. When we left at 8:30, we found a parking ticket! On a positive note, the people that worked there were very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Scabies, staph infection, and pink eye were on my mind...”
Reviews.Author: FiWillie
Reviews.Content: We are fair people...we are very cooperative in even the most adverse situations but Rodeway was lacking on so many levels... Pros: Location: It IS downtown near Mercy hospital and right in Mt Vernon. Within walking distance to many sites and historic locations. Breakfast: We hear the waffles are amazing Room: Room was larger than I expected and the bathrooms were small. The furniture was relatively new. We had a large cieling to knee-high window. There are refrigerators in the rooms. CONS: 1. There is no dedicated parking and it is in a residential area (brownstones) where permits are required. We drove 3 hrs from Virginia in driving rain and had to walk 3 blocks with our luggage. 2. Has just been taken over by major chain and it does not show. Towels were tattered and dingy, there was a brownish-yellow stain on the bathroom wall. There were splashes of grey liquid on the wall in the shower. 3. We tried 2 open the TV armoire and the knob fell off. 4. The comforter did not smell fresh & clean. There was a strong odor of incense throughout the halls and rooms. If you are on a budget and absolutely have to be downtown and need just a basic experience with free breakfast~fine. If you can spring for another location, do so. The front desk clerk offered us a different room but our comfort and expectations had been completely ravaged! The clerk ASSURED us that we would not receive a refund despite our disappointment. That was about 2 hours ago. We are now at a lovely Holiday Inn for $10 more and we will be calling the corporate customer care!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: traveler1234501
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Baltimore, my first choice in hotel accommodations is the Rodeway Inn. Its’ convenient downtown location at 723 St. Paul Street puts me within an easy commute of many of Baltimore’s finest attractions. The economical room price is a big plus and the friendly and helpful staff always makes my stays pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice; surprised at recommendations”
Reviews.Author: ChandlerOntario
Reviews.Content: The good: no bedbugs; seemed clean. The bad: No outlet in the bathroom for shaving, curling iron, hair dryer (maybe because there's no hair dryer?). Hole - approximately 5 inches in diameter - in the floor, a tripping hazard covered by carpeting. No queen or king beds - all standard full-size. Parking 2 blocks away (not recommended for nighttime walking alone). The ugly: thin, poor-fitting sheets that would not stay on the bed after one rolls over. The mattress pad had another odd pad over it that would also bunch up - one would awaken in the middle of the night on the bare mattress. Our chosen hotel, Henderson's Wharf, was not available for the first of our 3-night stay in Baltimore. We made the fateful decision to look for an inexpensive place for our first night, as we knew we wouldn't be there long. I did a search on Trip Advisor, and thought Roadway Inn would be an appropriate choice. It may be - for a niche class of solo travelers who have no car and a need to be in the Mount Vernon area of Baltimore - and who don't care about bedding, or who never move in their sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was beautiful and very clean...”
Reviews.Author: badbyzz607
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and very clean, the staff was excellent and were a pleasure to deal with. Very nice neighborhood everything was within walking distance. There is also free bus service to downtown which is great!! Inter harbor is a quick ten minute walk and is easy to get to. Over all I enjoyed my stay and will definatly return to this hotel!!! A++++++++

Reviews.Title: “I can't understand the good reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Vidalson
Reviews.Content: I dont' usually write bad reviews, but I cannot understand the good ones for this hotel, unless the hosts got the "new rooms" announced. We were given a very old room in the "basement" (although it had windows and view of the street). No place to eat the breakfast, moreover, and the room was clean but a bit scary.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly serviceable place...”
Reviews.Author: DJMAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: Wanted a decent place close to the baseball game. Couldn't beat the price, or the free bus for downtown across the street. Room was clean and COOL (record heat that day), and the staff was quite helpful. Sadly, no parking - but managed to get a place on the street nearby. Some street noise, too, but nothing to ruin the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Hilton, but a great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: am84
Reviews.Content: The rooms are bigger than expected, but the bathroom was definitely in need of some TLC. I was on the first floor, so I especially heard a lot of street noise, which disrupted my sleep. However, the beds were comfortable and free wifi and breakfast were available. I asked if I could leave my bag for a few hours after I had checked out so that I did not have to take it with me to a meeting, and the staff graciously complied, which I really appreciated. One big warning: around 10:00 PM I was flipping through the (very limited) channels and one of them was extreme hardcore pornography. Can you imagine if I had children in the room? The next morning, this channel said "DirectTV - press to activate," so someone in charge of the TV had to have turned on this channel. I only stayed one night, so I do not have the pleasure of knowing if this is a normal, nightly occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Practicality
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a deal if you are not a princess or travelling with one. It's situated on the free bus line which will whisk you to Baltimore's quaint harbour front in 10 minutes (note: when the bus was full, the driver did not accept additional passengers, but you can walk there in 15-20 minutes. The room we had on the first floor was adequate, with only a double bed, which was comfortable, but if you are used a queen size or larger, it will be cozy. At times, we could hear the street noise, so if you are sensitive to that, you may want to bring some ear-plugs. The continental breakfast, which included waffles you make on the spot, and can take to your room, was a nice start to the day. The people running the hotel were exceedingly nice and very helpful. There are some restaurants within a walking distance and you can also order in from a couple of delivery spots - we ordered a pizza (I think it was called Mike's) and it was good. Overall, Rodeway Inn was a very inexpensive spot that felt homey and was comfortable. No luxuries like flat-screen TV, but free internet worked perfectly. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “sensible & economical choice”
Reviews.Author: alley22
Reviews.Content: PRO: staff is eager to please. convenient location, especially since free PURPLE bus line stops almost right at the hotel. CON: no elevator street noise no hotel parking (but I managed to find a place on the street where I could park for free until 9 a.m.) Stayed in cheapest room type; these are located up 3 long flights of steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Excellent Staff - Definitely a great value”
Reviews.Author: xzEnder1241zx
Reviews.Content: I'm a college kid, so my budget was kind of limited, but I wanted to take my girlfriend on a weekend trip for our anniversary. For the special rate of $80 a night, it was definitely worth it. The room was extremely clean, although you could tell it was older. It was pretty small. The cable in the room didn't work, but the WiFi worked great and I used my NetFlix account to watch movies, so it worked out. The mattress was extremely firm - not something I'm used to, so it affected my sleep. The continental breakfast was good - wafflemaker, muffins, donuts, bread for toast, cereal, as well as milk, apple juice, OJ. The staff was extremely courteous, from the night watchman/breakfast manager to the guy at the front desk. It's in a great location in MidTown - a good neighborhood. Less than a mile from the Inner Harbor. My gf's experience in cities is extremely limited and she felt safe walking at night. The one major complaint I have is that the doors to the rooms are really thin.You can hear pretty much everything going on in the hallway outside the room. If you're a light sleeper, it may be difficult to get to sleep. Overall, if you're on a tight budget, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: dp3_traveler
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay in, location is most suitable to all, very hygienic, very good staff, I am satisfied with the all facility they have provided. Rates are also very economical. I will choose this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but set your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: klmonline
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a hopping Saturday in June when everything else near the Inner Harbor was sold out. It's a 20 minute walk to the harbor. Okay during daylight, but the hookers and pimps were setting up shop on street corners by dinner time. Bus service and taxi service will get you back and forth quickly and cheaply. The hotel price is great compared to anything else remotely close to the harbor, but you need to have clear expectations of what you will be getting into. The hotel looks and feels quite old. There are tall steep wooden staircases covered by old carpeting leading to the guest rooms. There are no elevators. There are only about 6 rooms per floor. Ours was on the top floor. Including the front steps to the lobby, that was 66 steps to carry luggage up and down on check in/out. Do not attempt this hotel if you lack stair climbing stamina. Both public spaces and our room (118) had chipped and peeling paint on the walls and frames, along with plumbing pipes sticking out of roughly punched gaping holes in the walls. This applied to our shower head, the sink drain, and a wall pipe in the hallway. I also noted an open electrical junction box just sitting exposed in a wall punchout in the hallway. The shower stall had dirty stains on the plastic enclosure walls. Bath towels were cheap and thin handtowel size. The bed has a plastic barrier sheet underneath the bottom sheet, causing great rustling noises every time you or your partner change positions. Rooms have one double bed -- Rather small for two people in this day and age of queen and king beds everywhere. The complimentary breakfast is served in a small area with no seating. Put your cereal and day-old donuts on a tray and carry it to your room. We noted no interior noise disturbances, but from our top-floor room we heard loud street noises all night. People revving engines, sirens blaring (Mercy Hospital is nearby), and people calling to each other. The hotel is on a corner and in the middle of the block is a laundromat that seemed to serve as a gathering place for many destitute-looking people. I parked my car on the street with serious reservations about its safety, but had no problems whatsoever. Because of traffic delays, we got to the hotel around 5:30pm on Saturday. The clerk greeted us with "I just called your home phone number. I didn't know if you were going to show up or not. Everyone else is checked in and I'm about to go off duty." That seemed like a strange deadline time for accepting checkins! So this does give you a cheap stay option in a normally expensive city, but you have to be prepared for what you get for the money. If budget is a priority, go for it. If cleanliness, building codes, or accessibility are a concern you may have to pay more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “MY LANDING ZONE IN USA”
Reviews.Author: vamala143
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! 1st experience of Rodeway Inn, and will be back again for sure. Great location (just around the corner from our theatre), few streets from the Harbor, ideally located for eating too, with good restaurants only a couple of minutes away. Staff were excellent, really and truly the most friendly people in a hotel I have come across, from reception right down to the waiting staff and the housekeeping, every person met us with a genuine smile and a cheery hello. Room was clean, shower was excellent(I like a bracing shower in the morning to wake myself up, not a pathetic trickle you so often get). Being on the 2nd floor however (and the fact the we are British therefore, well used to the cold!) we simply could not get our air con low enough. Breakfast was again great, the buffet being well stocked at all times and everything well prepared and of good quality (the Waffle was DELICIOUS!). Can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Rodeway Inn deserve a BIG pat on the back.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience that does not burn a hole in your pocket”
Reviews.Author: Mngt_Doc
Reviews.Content: Great staff, clean rooms, all amenities work, walking distance to great tourist locations, historical and classy...overall a fantastic experience...highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaguji10
Reviews.Content: A decent and unique historical hotel. Sometimes they are booked up. Driving around the are in the self-parking can get you dizzy. Just don't drive it very fast. The in-room amenities are pretty good. Overall, a nice place to stay. I believe this is really an economical CLEAN hotel in Baltimore. Hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. I wil be back. Friendly and...”
Reviews.Author: Akbar_Badshah
Reviews.Content: Perfect. I wil be back. Friendly and helpful staff. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “In a word... Surreal”
Reviews.Author: OnMyWay88
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Rodeway Inn and never once saw another hotel guest. After a couple days, I began to wonder what the hell was going on. It was surreal. Occasionally, we'd return in the evening and there would a guy sitting on a bench in the hallway, but he didn't look like he was staying there, just kind of hanging out. By the end of our stay, i was starting to have serious doubts as to the legitimacy of this "hotel." Our stay at the Rodeway wasn't bad, but it was just full of annoyances -- it literally took 15 minutes for the water in the shower to heat up. There was no means to warm anything up: no microwave or coffeemaker in the room or on the premises at all, which is a bummer if you want a late night cup of coffee or to warm up a snack. The bed was tiiiiny. The free continental breakfast was appreciated, but it was bare bones to the max. The huge tub of waffle batter looked like it was made 6 months ago. No fruit, yogurt or anything that wasn't from a box or a mix. The location of the hotel is decent: exactly one mile from the Inner Harbor and near some bars and museums. I will give the Rodeway points for cleanliness and customer service. When i inquired about a microwave and was told that there was none, the man working the front desk kindly offered to heat up some water for me in a tiny hotpot he had. Though I was really craving a cup of coffee, his act of kindness at least got me a cup of tea. He then proceeded to heat up water for me every night -- unprompted -- for the remainder of our stay. Bottom line: if you're on a bare bones budget, the Rodeway will suffice. Otherwise, pony up the extra $20 and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting The University of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: dspusaf
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Rodeway Inn in downtown Baltimore and I found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful with my questions about the city. The hotel was very clean and quiet and the room was comfortable. The Internet connection was good and the continental breakfast was satisfying. The hotel is located within walking distance to restaurants, cafes, the university campus and the train station. I would recommend a stay at this hotel and I will definately stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel.!”
Reviews.Author: rinkubabe
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse were vistitn marlyland to meet one of my realatives, and needed a place to stay that wasn't really far and pretty clean. Then we found this inn called the rodewayinn hotel, we had never been there. When we saw the hotel from the outside it was reall attracting and looked like it was a really good place to stay. As soon as we walked thru the doors we were gretted very nicely by the staff. They were very helpful and courteoius from the check in time to the checkout, they really made me feel like home. The loactaion of the hotel was very nice for me i could go to my relatives house as i please very easily. The breakfast was really good to and good hours i think for everyone, it was also very clean. If yuh ever go to maryland and see rodewayinn hotel i would 100 percent recommend this hotel for you!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent facility with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GONASAPasadena
Reviews.Content: My trip was very successful. This hotel made me feel like home. It was easy to get around. Would recommend my other friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: drleoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 3 nights while attending a national conference, the best thing is the location,within walking distance to inner harbor,the marriot waterfront,University of maryland,etc, location is safe,I had no problems walking around even at night,the staff is extremely friendly and were very helpful,they answered all my questions and helped me with directions,getting a cab at 4.30 am,my stay was very pleasant,rooms were spacious,neat and clean,warm and cozy,feels like home and not a hotel,very quiet.,would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay over”
Reviews.Author: Mike_PA123
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip of 5 days from such a nice hotel. we cover all the places nearby like Inner Harbour area, Baltimore Acquarium and of course our great visit to Washington DC. All the family members were very happy with kind and courteous staff. The cleanliness of the hotel along with nice and well maintained beds are a plus point with this low rate hotel. I would come again for sure to old Baltimore City and also the acquarium again as my kids wants to visit fish again...

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel in the center of the town”
Reviews.Author: TanToulouse
Reviews.Content: Great room, clean. Just a little noisy at night Very near the peabody institute Not very far from Inner harbor OK for the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The best for low cost”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Stubbs
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the way the place was very elegant.The staff was very courteous and helpful the room was emmaculate.free rob and slippers in the room and the breakfast was excellent the price was amazing for a hotel room in the city i reccommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: allaol
Reviews.Content: It is in the culture district of Baltimore, a nice neighbourhood. The room is clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: sndas
Reviews.Content: Very clean place and also affordable. Close to John Hopkins hospital. The hospital has the shuttle service round the corner of the hotel . Love the breakfast. The night manager was very helpful. Thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: nsdhari
Reviews.Content: It was a great pleasure to be at the Hotel. It was thoroughlly enjoyable and the service provided has to be commended. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER BOOK A ROOM THERE !!! EVER !!!! NEVER !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Msdiva911
Reviews.Content: PLEASE DO NOT BOOK THIS !!!!! We booked a room for 3 nights because it was located in the downtown area...We asked to see the room before paying...first thing we noticed was the bed was a full size...not a Queen size bed as adverstised.. The man stated all the beds are the same size....We should've went somewhere else because it just got worst for there. After we got settled, I proceeded to iron my clothes...guess what there wasn't an iron, I called the front desk to ask for an iron...He was 'MIA" for about 30 mins, when I did locate him he gave me the iron but said they don't have any ironing boards ...WTH !!! NO IRONING BOARDS...GET THIS !!!! I HAD TO IRON ON THE BED...THAT IS NOT EXCEPTABLE...This was suppose to be a hotel/inn not....a MOTEL. Because we're pressed for time and didn't have access to a computer, we were stuck !!! Coming back to the room it was freezing cold...I'm searching for the air controllers...OMG !!! they control the heat and air. I had to call the front desk and have them turn the air conditioner off...then i called back to turn the heat on....JUST HORRIBLE....THIS IS A FAMILY OWNED BUSINESS WITH LITTLE OR NO SERVICE.. I got sick...I wanted some hot water to make some tea, it was around 1030am- they said comp. breakfast was over and they couldn't make any more hot water...i asked if they have a mircowave...the answer was NO !!! Once again I wanted to get dressed and the front desk was MIA again, I couldn't located them for about 20mins this time.... As you can see I was very, very disappointed and frustrated in many ways.... Last thing ! my tv wouldn't work around 8pm, i called the front desk once again, they told me no one can fix it until 10am...So I had to lay in bed all night without a TV. We normally book the hotel further out but decided to try this place. NEVER EVER AGAIN, Spend you money and time and go somewhere else because you will be disappointed.. It's just funny how picture can make you stay somewhere, on their front desk it was a digital photo display of the rooms, showing they have an iron and iron board....but they Don't...also they had a vending machine with two flavors of soda- spite and coke...I don't drink soda...what happened to water/juice or snacks !!!!! PLEASE TAKE MY ADVICE I CAN GO ON AND ON !!!!!! BOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE....THANKS FOR LISTENING.....

Reviews.Title: “Anybody got time and money to waste?”
Reviews.Author: OriolesFan84
Reviews.Content: The owner was INCREDIBLY rude and unaccommodating. When I asked for an explanation of the discrepancy of prices between what I booked on hostelbookers.com and what he received, he COMMANDED the 'front desk' worker (if you can even call that a front desk) not to rent me the room. He gave no proper explanation as to why he would not accept my reservation or rent me a room and when I asked to speak to him again, I found out that he also instructed the worker not to call him back. While I was talking with the worker and waiting for the police (can you believe I had to call the police on my vacation?!?), he informed me that the owner of the hotel has done this before on many occasions--simply refusing to rent rooms to customers WITH RESERVATIONS for any reason at all. As you can imagine, this can be very inconvenient at 11pm with 2 large suitcases in Baltimore. I will be reporting this extremely unprofessional, unclassy and disgusting roach motel to the Better Business Bureau and am in talks with legal counsel to file a civil lawsuit against them for a blatant breach of contract. Oh yeah, my recommendation? DON'T GO.

Reviews.Title: “If you want an economy hotel in Baltimore -- this is it!”
Reviews.Author: ickifrank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Midtown for two nights in mid-March 2009. As anyone who is looking for a hotel in Baltimore quickly discovers -- nothing is cheap! We paid only $120 (total) for two nights at the Midtown Hotel. We could not have found another hotel anywhere in the city for that rate for even ONE night. Anyone who selects the Midtown does so for two reasons: price and location. Neither will disappoint. As I already mentioned, the rate is a steal and its location is better then the Water Front. There are a lot of cute restaurants in quick walking distance of varying prices. There is a nice coffee shop/bookstore across the street called Red Emma's that we really enjoyed. It is a one mile walk to the water front. The staff was pleasant. It is a safe neighborhood with beautiful surrounding architechture. There is also a laundromat across the street if you are planning an extended stay. Our room was huge for the price we paid -- full size bed, desk, two sitting chairs, two tv's, etc. The free wireless internet was really quick. The place was clean - things just were a bit worn. The free breakfast consisted of one type of pastry and coffee. The front desk manager also offered us orange juice. As for critiques: 1) The entire hotel exhibits poor worksmanship. The painting is poorly done and things are done sloppily. 2) The windows sometimes vibrated with traffic noise. 3) It took a long time for the shower to warm up (we were on the 2nd floor) However you get a lot of value for your money, so what do you expect when it is a 3rd of the price? Also, while the website advertises parking in a nearby garage, the desk manager had a hard time giving directions to it. While most parking garages are outrageously expensive, we found one close by on the corner of E. Monument St. and N. Calvert St.. They have an Early Bird special of $7 if you are in before 9AM and out by 6PM. Overnight parking was $5. However, you can park on any of the area streets (including in front of the Midtown) for free in the evenings. Overall, if you are looking for a budget hotel in a fantastic location, the Midtown is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel- not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Pribislav
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say this, but the Midtown Suites has been one of my bad hotel experiences in the US. I think it is absolutely not worth the money. The only good thing is actually the location because its close to Mount Vernon, the Peabody Institute and the Charles St with a lot of restaurants and night life. The cleanliness was very unsatisfying. Out of four sheets three were somehow dirty and had weird stains on it. The shower took a least 10 minutes to get warm in the morning, though in the evening it was faster. The staff was trying to be helpfull but probably due to the management even little things turned out to be difficult. I.e. it wasn't even possible to split the bill into half. On one day we came home late just to find the door to our room wide open. They said it was due to some painting job done during the day but didn't care to inform us in advance. Nothing was missing anyway but it didn't improved our impression of this place. And so every day some kind of problem came up. In generall I really would say that it is to much money for to little of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for price paid”
Reviews.Author: BrandonMS-TripTaker
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent stay for the price paid. I stayed for a week and received great service. Facilities are being renovated, so should continue to improve. Cost was well below most other hotels/motels in the area. I definitely will stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Mid Town
HotelInfo.Address: 723 Saint Paul St., Baltimore, MD 21202 (Formerly Midtown Suites)
